オプション1: After fleeing the monsters, Star Man kept picking up acorns as he searched for the landmark rock.
After wandering lost in the forest all day, he finally found the landmark rock.
(This is it...! No mistake!)
"Hey!! Anybody!"
Star Man shouted, but there was no reply.

(Should I have specified the time too?
Maybe... they've already died...)

With no water or food and monsters packed unnaturally densely in the forest,
assuming they were alive was unrealistic.

(No... I can't give up yet.
...I'll make a fire and send up smoke.)
To avoid starting a forest fire, Star Man decided to make the fire on a rock.
(I've seen fire‑making in videos, but I've never done it.)
One hour later...
After rubbing a branch for an hour, Star Man managed to ignite it.
(My hands hurt so much...)
Star Man's hands were covered in cuts.

He grew the fire into a bonfire,
then kept shouting toward the mountains.
"Hey! Triangle Man!! Square Man!!"
After four hours, toward evening, the children's voices came from far away.
(Thank goodness...! They're alive..!)

"Hey!"
When Star Man called out, the children ran toward him.
"Look. I found coconuts. You can drink."
"Yeah..."
Star Man took the coconuts from the bag, cracked them, and handed them to the kids.
"Where have you been until now?"
"Over there, eating acorns."
"I see. What about water?"
"A white person gave us some."
"...? A white person...?"
"Dunno."

"I see... There's a place over there where coconut trees grow.
Let's go that way."
"Yeah"

"On the way there's a ruin, so we'll go there first,
then head to the coconuts."
"Got it."
"A white person came, y'know."
Triangle Man told Star Man.

"Like, they didn't say a single word.
They set down some bamboo and went somewhere.
There was water inside the bamboo."
"A fairy... or maybe a ghost..."
"Haha."

"You two. We're going to the place with the coconut trees now,
but there are various kinds of monsters along the way."
"Okay"
"Be careful not to get close. If you don't approach, they won't move."
The three headed for the ruins.
